charges.charge_description: 21:843A=CD.F, 21:844A=CP.F:  defendants Williams, Simmons and Marsh obtained possession of a controlled substance by fraud and defendants Connolly, Clark, A. Wilson and B. Wilson were in possession of a controlled substance

21:843A=CD.F, 21:844A=CP.F:  defendants Williams, Simmons and Marsh obtained possession of a controlled substance by fraud and defendants Connolly, Clark, A. Wilson and B. Wilson were in possession of a controlled substance

21:843A=CD.F, 21:844A=CP.F:  defendants Williams, Simmons and Marsh obtained possession of a controlled substance by fraud and defendants Connolly, Clark, A. Wilson and B. Wilson were in possession of a controlled substance

21:843A=CD.F, 21:844A=CP.F:  defendants Williams, Simmons and Marsh obtained possession of a controlled substance by fraud and defendants Connolly, Clark, A. Wilson and B. Wilson were in possession of a controlled substance

charges.charge_disposition: Sentencing held. Pursuant to the defendants request for Probation under 18:3607, probation is imposed for one year. Standard conditions of probation are imposed along with special conditions: submit to a mental health evaluation. If indicated by the evaluation, the defendant shall participate in mental health treatment. Defendant shall provide the U.S. Probation Office with access to an requested personal and/or business financial information. Defendant shall submit to a search of her person, property, vehicle, place of residence or any other property under her control, based upon reasonable suspicion and permit confiscation of any evidence or contraband. After one year, if the defendant has been compliant, the government will move to discharge the defendant from probation.

charges.charge_description: 21:843A=CD.F, 21:844A=CP.F:  defendants Williams, Simmons and Marsh obtained possession of a controlled substance by fraud and defendants Connolly, Clark, A. Wilson and B. Wilson were in possession of a controlled substance

charges.charge_disposition: Sentencing held. Pursuant to the defendants request for Probation under 18:3607, probation is imposed for one year. Standard conditions of probation are imposed along with special conditions: submit to a mental health evaluation. If indicated by the evaluation, the defendant shall participate in mental health treatment. Defendant shall provide the U.S. Probation Office with access to an requested personal and/or business financial information. The defendant shall submit to a search of her person, property, vehicle, place of residence or any other property under her control, based upon reasonable suspicion and permit confiscation of any evidence or contraband. Defendant has paid the restitution. After one year, if the defendant has been compliant, the government will move to discharge the defendant from probation.
